snippet: At least 110 people were injured in the bloodiest clashes between the two sides of Egypt’s main ideological divide since the start of the revolt that toppled President Hosni Mubarak.
abstract: Intense confrontations result when hundreds of Islamist supporters of Egypt’s new Pres Mohamed Morsi clash with his secular opponents in Tahrir Square, evolving into battle of fists, rocks and Molotov cocktails;  conflict,  bloodiest fight between the two sides of Egypt’s main ideological divide in the 20 months since the toppling of Pres Hosni Mubarak, marks first time Morsi supporters have used violence against his opponents.
lead_paragraph: At least 110 people were injured in the bloodiest clashes between the two sides of Egypt’s main ideological divide since the start of the revolt that toppled President Hosni Mubarak.

headline.seo: Morsi’s Critics and Backers Clash in Tahrir Square
headline.main: Opponents and Supporters of Egypt’s President Clash
headline.print_headline: Opponents and Supporters Of Egypt’s President Clash
